alert.note: Alert for Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Laurel, northern Pulaski and southern Rockcastle Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 626 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Woodstock, or 14 miles north of Somerset, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Woodstock, Bandy, Bobtown, Willailla, Bee Lick, Quail, Dabney and Ottowa around 635 PM EDT. Level Green, Valley Oak, Bromo, Wabp, Shopville and Spiro around 640 PM EDT. Pongo, Bloss, Hansford, Sand Springs and Wellhope around 645 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Luner, Billows, Camp Wildcat, Sand Hill, Wood Creek Lake, Hare, Hazel Patch, Bernstadt and Bunch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central Kentucky.
